t: I*p looked up and saw a man with a measuring line in his hand.
I asked, “Where are you going?” He*p answered me, “To measure Jerusalem to determine its width and length.”
Then*p the angel who was speaking with me went out, and another angel went out to meet him.
He said to him, “Run and tell this young man: Jerusalem will be inhabited without walls because of the number of people and animals in it.”
The declaration of the Lord:*s “I myself will be a wall of fire around it, and I will be the glory within it.”
“Listen!*p Listen! Flee from the land of the north”- this is the Lord’s*s declaration - “for I have scattered you like the four winds of heaven” - this is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“Listen, Zion! Escape, you who are living with Daughter Babylon.”
For the Lord*s of Armies says this: “In pursuit of his glory, he sent me against the nations plundering you, for whoever touches you touches the pupil of my eye.
For look, I am raising my hand against them, and they will become plunder for their own servants. Then you will know that the Lord*s of Armies has sent me.
“Daughter*p Zion, shout for joy and be glad, for I am coming to dwell among you” - this is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“Many nations will join themselves to the Lord*s on that day and become my people. I will dwell among you, and you will know that the Lord*s of Armies has sent me to you.
The Lord*s will take possession of Judah as his portion in the Holy Land, and he will once again choose Jerusalem.
Let all humanity be silent before the Lord,*s for from his holy dwelling he has roused himself.”
